body_content.explanation: from or referring to the period of time between about 485 and 445 million years ago, in which there were many different types of animals in the sea, including vertebrates (= animals with backbones), but no life on land:
examples: For his PhD he mapped Welsh Ordovician rocks and described new species of fossils.
In mid Ordovician times a volcanic island arc is thought to have extended through the English Lake District, Wales and Newfoundland.

body_content.explanation: the period of time between about 485 and 445 million years ago, in which there were many different types of animals in the sea, including vertebrates (= animals with backbones), but no life on land:
examples: This first happened early in the Ordovician.
As the Ordovician progressed, the separation between the two continents decreased and they both acquired warm environments.
